_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Crystal Creamery Modesto, Facility ID: 100000127098, was prevented from submitting the RMP data elements by the August 11, 2022 due date of the 5-year update through the RMPeSubmit program on CDX due to an error in the updated RMPeSubmit program deployed on August 5, 2022.  The RMP reporting center is aware of the issue.

eview practices, and Crystal Creamery Modesto will maintain the most current versions on site. Thus, the most current version CalARP/RMP/PSM, related documents, and elements maintained on site may vary slightly from the information in submittals made to EPA and other regulatory agencies.in preparing for and responding to emergency situations that may occur at the Facility, such as responding to a fire, an unplanned or accidental release of a hazardous material, medical emergencies, bomb threats, site evacuation, etc. The ERP also provides resources for agency notification, coordination among Facility personnel and outside responders, and internal and/or external use in emergency planning/preparedness. Emergency response actions are coordinated with local emergency response agencies annually.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Crystal Creamery Modesto performed a Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) in June 2022 and generated a list of recommendations to improve safety and mitigate potential releases. Crystal Creamery Modesto will address PHA recommendations within the 2 ½-year time frame set forth in the January 1, 2015, CalARP requirements. These changes to improve safety include:

	Assess ammonia detection system and emergency shutdown requirements to IIAR 9 for both the A Side and B Side ammonia refrigeration systems. 
	Update access to computerized system controls for operators.
	Restrict unauthorized personnel from accessing engine rooms.
	Develop operating procedures for the pump down of equipment.

Crystal Creamery Modesto recognizes that the CalARP/RMP/PSM is a continuous process for evaluating, monitoring, and improving anhydrous ammonia hand

ling operations at its facility. As such, this document and related attachments and program elements will evolve as Crystal Creamery Modesto continues their ongoing focus and dedication of risk minimization and safety improvement for their employees and surrounding community. Crystal Creamery Modesto will submit revised information if a change occurs that is considered significant and requires resubmission under the regulations. However, minor improvements/modifications to the CalARP/RMP/PSM, related attachments, and program elements will be incorporated consistent with Crystal Creamery Modesto internal res are being followed. The CalARP/RMP/PSM prevention program elements:
?	Process Safety Information
?	Process Hazard Analysis
?	Operating Procedures
?	Training Programs
?	Mechanical Integrity
?	Management of Change
?	Pre-startup Safety Review
?	Compliance Audits
?	Incident Investigation
?	Employee Participation
?	Hot Work Permits
?	Contractor Safety
?	Trade Secrets (none associated with the ammonia refrigeration system)

The predominant safety concern with a closed-loop ammonia system is the inadvertent buildup of pressure exceeding pressure ratings or capacities of equipment due to ammonia expansion. The Crystal Creamery Modesto ammonia systems are continuously monitored by automated control systems that shut down components upon deviations from normal operating conditions. Further, the pressure relief vales of the A Side and B Side refrigeration processes are equipped with pressure relief valves that discharge to a water-filled diffusion tank. 

Other safety features at the facility include: 
	Central computer monitoring and control system;
	Emergency shutdown systems;
	Component specific safety shutdowns that are independent of the central computer control system;
	Fire alarms and sprinkler system; and
	Ammonia leak detection systems in the engine rooms and process areas with ammonia equipment;

Five-Year Accident History
CalARP regulations require a review

of the 5-year accident history at the regulated facility. The history must include accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage. (19 CCR 2750.9). There were no reportable releases of ammonia at the facility in the last 5 years.

Emergency Response Program
Crystal Creamery Modesto is a responding facility and has developed an Emergency Response Plan (ERP). The ERP provides Facility personnel general guidelines and procedures Stationary Source and Regulated Substance
Crystal Creamery, Inc. Modesto (Crystal Creamery Modesto) Facility (Facility) is located at 415 Kansas Avenue, Modesto, California, approximately 0.1 miles east of State Route 99 (Golden State Highway) and 0.5 miles north of State Route 132. The facility is located in an area zoned for commercial and industrial use and classified under NAICS Code 311511 (Fluid Milk Processing). The Facility process and packages dairy and fruit products. Anhydrous ammonia is used in the Facilitys A Side and B Side ammonia refrigeration processes. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Crystal Creamery Modesto has developed a California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program in general accordance with the requirements of California Health & Safety Code, Title 19, Division 2, Chapter 4, and Federal EPA requirements, 40 CFR Part 68 Risk Management Plan (RMP), and federal OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) 29 CFR 1910.119 and California OSHA 8 CCR 5189 to enhance existing anhydrous ammonia safety and emergency response program. Crystal Creamery Modesto is committed to worker and public safety through investment in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration systems. Crystal Creamery Modestos policy is to impl

ement controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. Crystal Creamery Modesto has developed an Emergency Response Plan to respond to a release of ammonia in the unlikely event that a chemical release does occur at the Facility.

General Accidental Release Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
The prevention program elements of CalARP/RMP/PSM are implemented by Crystal Creamery Modesto to manage process safety issues associated with the use of ammonia for refrigeration. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practic
